inn1.comm: Tamim is off! Easy as you like, on leg stump from Anderson and Tamim whipped it away through midwicket for four
great stuff from Tamim, no fuss, just boundaries. Anderson dished it up full and wide, Tamim crashed it through point, where despite a diving effort from Broad at third man, it goes for another four
more runs again, and this is actually a better shot, driving on the up, carefully through cover for a couple
finally order is restored, a decent line, a decent length and defended
much better from Anderson, who as ever looks a touch gloomy because the sun is shining, it's on off stump and Tamim defends
Tamim keeps the strike, clipping a leg-side delivery to deep square leg for a single
I wonder if this was Strauss's plan, I hope not. Short and wide and Tamim flashed a cut shot, really powerfully through point for four. Top stuff
Tamim is really firing, Bresnan dishes up a slower ball outside leg stump, Tamim turns his wrists over it and send it down to fine leg for four
better from Bresnan, it couldn't be much worse to be fair, back of a length on off stump and Tamim can't squeeze a cut shot away
single here for Tamim, worked into the midwicket region, finally brings Imrul Kayes on strike
Kayes is away, nurdling to square leg for one
well Tamim doesn't connect, but only because it was wide outside leg
another slower ball, this time it's better directed, Tamim worked it to square leg where Bell, back in the side today for the first time since November 2008, made a neat sliding stop
Anderson went full to Kayes who crisply drove, without much timing, through the covers for a couple, Tamim wants three but can't get it
more runs here! Not great bowling it must be said, leg-stump half volley, Imrul clipped it firmly past mid on for four
this time it's a better line outside off stump and left alone
nothing on offer here, worked quietly to midwicket
perhaps Anderson has finally found his line, on and around off stump, defended to point
fullish ball is very firmly struck but driven straight to extra cover
neatly played by Tamim, Bresnan is trying to take pace off the ball but it's misdirected a fraction and allows Tamim to work it round the corner with soft hands for a couple
quieter this time from Tamim, just worked to midwicket
Bresnan bangs it in short, Tamim launches into a big pull shot, playing it nicely but straight down to fine leg
better line to Kayes, just outside off stump and the batsman leaves alone
good line again, it's probably easier bowling to a guy like Kayes, and defended
much better second half to the over, tight off-stump line defended
who duly starts with a wide, but it looked a brisker wide, so that's something for the bowler to cheer about
and again. One wide is forgiveable, two is careless
ah, that's much better, hint of movement into the batsman, Tamim was trapped on the crease a fraction, and defended
very clearly Broad has one thing in mind for Tamim - no room. Everything is arrowing into the hip area
that's the danger with that line, and quite why fine leg is up in the circle if Broad is going to attack the that area is beyond me, on the hips and tickled round the corner
that's probably why the man is in the circle at short fine leg, protecting the single as it's whipped around the corner
nicely played, similar line into the hip and Tamim works it in front of midwicket a couple more
this time it's on and around off stump and defended. Better over that for England but still six off it
not much happening with the ball it must be said, but it's a decent line at least and Kayes blocks
Bresnan just holding it back of a length and defended by Kayes
Kayes is not quite turning the strike over as he needs to, this was on leg stump, but the leg-side nurdle found the fielder
good line from Bresnan, probing in the channel outside off, and defended
oops, having bowled a decent line all over, Bresnan shoves one well down the leg side
thrown up a touch wider outside off, inviting a flashing blade, which connects well enough to collect a single
Tamim plays this so easily, how much time does he have!? Got into position to guide it to third man very early

Broad strikes! He's done it again. And a collective groan from all the crowd as Tamim departs. It was nothing more than a straight ball on a length, Tamim aimed another glide to third man, but it was far too close to pull of the shot and it crashed into his pads to trap him in front
Broad's plan is very clear here, banging it in very short indeed and it sails over the crouching batsman
this time it's just back of a length and clipped into the leg side for a single
good ball here, on a length around off stump and blocked firmly
another dot ball here as Kayes plays around a length ball
more securely played this time, guided down to third man from outside off stump
Bresnan persists with his back-of-a-length approach, worked into the leg side
pretty zippy from Bresnan, but down the leg side
better line this time, it's defended towards cover
well, it's an easier game when Tamim is away, and Bresnan lands another good ball around off stump that Kayes defends
nothing on off for the batsman, around off stump and blocked
strange shot from Kayes, probably becoming a touch nervy with all the dot balls, he tries to guide it down to third man but picks out the fielder
finally Bresnan goes full, Kayes tries to smash a drive too hard and can't time it
Broad has settled into a good rhythm here, finding decent pace and carry on a good line
Siddique can't quite get anything away here, aiming a whip to leg but missing
pressure building here on Siddique, needs to find a single
banged in shorter, Siddique aims an upper-cut but doesn't really look like connecting
Broad sensing he's really in with a chance, he's really pinging them down swiftly and Siddique looks stuck
short again, Siddique tried to work it round the corner, but can't get much on it
fuller from Bresnan, on off stump and defended
finally a single it taken, worked into the leg side, and the throw comes in and hits the stumps but he's comfortably home
one single follows another as this is worked in front of midwicket for one
back of a length now from Bresnan, and pushed into the covers
I gave this straight out when I saw it, thankfully my opinion doesn't matter at all, it pitched well outside leg from a fuller length and crashed into the pads, big appeal but rightly not given
short ball to finish the over, and pulled firmly down to deep midwicket
touch short from Broad, a touch wide too and a very crisp cut, in front of point for four, well played
ooh, this is close, shorter and Siddique got into an awful position as he tried to fend it away, luckily doesn't go to short leg

ooh, good ball again from Broad. Short and climbing at Siddique, who once again can't get into a good position - trying and failing to ride the bounce - and ends up gloving it over the keeper for four
predictably it's a touch short again, Siddique getting a real peppering, gloved down to fine leg for one
good from Broad once more, fuller though this time and Kayes blocks
oh dear! No slip in place and Kayes collects four! The ball got a bit big on him as he tried to cut, ended up top-edging it to the vacant slip area for four
Siddique gets a rare full ball, and seems surprised that he did, ends up driving from the crease
slower ball completely defeats the batsman, who is through a defensive block before the ball arrives
this was the bouncer, and it's well directed but just a touch too high
fuller ball this time, tickled round the corner for one
pushed across Kayes and despite the edge last over he's happy to try and guide a cut shot away, plays it nicely down to third man
a touch short and Siddique wheels a good looking but poorly timed pull shot away to square leg for one
quiet end to the over and Kayes crisply blocks a length ball to mid off
Broad v Siddique looks like a battle only one man will win, but somehow Siddique is still there, pulling a short ball uncomfortably to mid on
perfect placement from Siddique! Short ball and he pulled down and powerfully, straight in between two diving fielders at square leg and fine leg
smart thinking from Broad, slower ball and much fuller, but Siddique happily punches down the ground to mid off
Bell almost pulls off a sensational run out here, under the helmet at short leg he dived to stop a leg-side clip and flicked the ball back at the stumps but narrowly missed
nicely played by Siddique, clipping it firmly to midwicket for one

oh dear, that's very harsh from the umpire. Given a dead ball by the umpire after Broad fired one down the leg side, the attempted-flick was missed but it ran away towards the fine leg boundary. Runs not given
he'll be pleased with this delivery though, good line, good length and defended
Siddique works this down to third man from outside off, bat well away from body but he connected well enough
and gone! That will cheer Anderson up! It was fullish around off stump, Kayes leant back and skewed a drive straight to Eoin Morgan at cover. Bit tame that dismissal but England won't mind at all
negotiates his first ball tidily enough, working it to leg
they won't come into play here, as it's left alone outside off
similar ball to finish the over, outside off stump, and left alone
slower ball from Broad, Siddique has settled a little bit more and defends carefully
gets a short ball here though, and doesn't handle it all that well, missing an attempted flap to the leg side
much fuller and much slower, smart bowling, but Siddique is up to it
this time it's short again, and Siddique jerks his head out the line
should have found a single here, it was speared towards his hip, but he couldn't connect as he tried to work it round the corner
connects well this time, whipping it in front of square on the leg side for a couple
curving in to the right-hander, defended towards short midwicket
hint of movement in again, but this starts on a leg-stump line and swings further down to be called wide
tapped softly between cover and mid-off, Raqibul calls early to pick up a single
drilled nicely, but straight to Yardy at mid-off. Good-looking shot for no runs
tapped defensively to the off side
slower ball, Anderson rolls the fingers over this and Junaid is way too early into the shot as he tries to drive on the up. Luckily for him, the ball loops up and over backward point
very full to finish, dug out to midwicket
floater on off stump to start, pushed cautiously to mid-on

bizarre! Raqibul gets down into a premeditated paddle-sweep, but just as the ball gets to him his studs slipped in the turf and he ended up doing the splits and tumbling over in the crease! Still managed to hit it, top effort that
whipped away square
pushed down the ground, Tredwell leaps over in his follow-through but can't cut it off
Tredwell comes round the wicket, Junaid leans forward to push into the covers
slightly quicker through the air and going on with the arm, Raqibul hangs back and taps the ball back to the bowler
landing on a length on middle and off and nipping in slightly through the air, Junaid pushes his weight back and drops the ball towards point
slammed to mid-off by Junaid, aggressive shot, but again it's rolled straight to the fielder. Good intent though, if he had got that a yard straighter it would've been four

flashing cover drive! Third time lucky for Siddique, as Anderson changes the angle but again feeds him a half-volley outside off. He's searching for swing, but the ball's been met with a full swing of the blade and screamed away to the cover boundary
definite shape away through the air as Anderson continues round the wicket, and the ball is angled behind point for a single
full and fast from Anderson, Raqibul leans over the ball to nudge to midwicket
push-and-run as Junaid sends the ball rolling just to mid-on's left. Sharp single, but they were safely in even if the throw had been on target
flighted on middle and off, Junaid stretches forward to smother it back down the pitch
stays deep in the crease this time to nudge the ball behind backward point
nicely-swept by Raqibul for his first boundary. He got down on one knee to sweep behind square, the fine leg fielder was very fine and couldn't get across in time. Good shot
pushed defensively to straight midwicket
punched into the covers, where a misfield allows runs
clipped infront of midwicket off the front foot
good start from Wright, who sends one down back-of-a-length to jar the splice of Junaid's bat.
pushed to backward point on the walk, straight to the fielder
Junaid presses forward and then back as he picks up the length, opening the face of the bat to guide the ball past backward point. That should've been cut off, slightly sloppy fielding again there
great delivery! Held cross-seam and cutting away off the pitch, Raqibul pushes inside the line and is beaten
slightly too straight in line, nudged to square-leg's right
nudged away on the leg side, and another single is the result
Junaid steps forward and whips across his front pad, looking for the single to midwicket. Straight to the fielder
that will be a single as Junaid places the ball softly into the gap in the covers, and that'll also be the Bangladesh 100
good rotation going on, Raqibul taps to square leg to keep the scoreboard ticking over

confusion in the running! But it doesn't cost Bangladesh... this time. I don't know what Raqibul was thinking - Junaid pushed the ball right into the gap and there was always one, he just stood at the crease watching the ball until Junaid was almost upon him. No harm in the end
another single, again pushed through the leg side
Bangladesh milking the spinner here, as Junaid clips to short fine leg
flapped to point, where again there is a slight fumble which allows them through for one. Good effort to stop the ball, but couldn't hold it cleanly
just too straight from Wright, Raqibul shuffles to off and tickles to fine leg. Off the pad though
another run where there shouldn't have been one! Raqibul pushed the ball straight to point, an unnecessary shy at the stumps was sent in and a run taken as the ball ricocheted off the stumps
driven on the up into the covers
more tip-and-run cricket. Again Raqibul was hesitant though - it was an easy single if they had just gone straight away, but he just dithered a moment and so it was quite tight in the end

Junaid, like many of the Bangladesh batsmen, has had his troubles against the short ball, but he's nailed this! Wright sent down an attempted bouncer but he just leaned back and cracked the ball infront of square to the midwicket boundary
well, looked like a seam-up delivery to start. Pushed into the covers, the fielder charges in to cut off the single
drilled to mid-on, again they consider a single but decide against it
that will be one, as Raqibul finds the gap to send the ball out to deep midwicket
Junaid opens the face of the blade to look for the single behind square, but point cuts it off
tapped infront of point this time, and they amble through for a single as the ball rolls into the deep
good, tight over from Collingwood. Driven to point once again, can't pick the gap and "no!" is the call
full and straight from Wright, and Junaid responds with the straightest of bats in defence
back-of-a-length, and the ball squirts off the outer half of the bat to beat Collingwood at gully and roll down to third man
full, and driven straight to the cover fielder on the edge of the circle

England are just beginning to regain some control now, as again Wright keeps a tight line and length and no run is taken. Raqibul and Junaid were starting to milk the bowling quite easily but have been quietened
edged! Something was bound to happen, Raqibul wasn't trying anything special, just pushed at a good slower legcutter. No slip in place, and that's four
pressure fully relieved now! Wright dishes up a short, wide ball and Raqibul carves through gully off the back foot
driven on the up out to the cover sweeper
good stuff from Collingwood, on a length and straight and Raqibul pushes the ball back to the bowler
punch-drive, but straight to mid-off
nudged to midwicket's right. Junaid had to motor to get in safely, but he was also helped by a throw that wasn't quite on target. Direct hit would've been very close indeed
driven into the covers
that's just kept a touch low ... not that low, but exaggerated responses from both the batsman and the 'keeper. You'd think it had shot through at ankle height to see them
watchful from Raqibul to start, just pushing to midwicket off the back foot
width from Yardy, and Raqibul scythes a cut behind square. Cut off before the rope though
Yardy goes very wide around the wicket and darts one in full and straight. Whipped between mid-on and midwicket
Junaid shuffles across to off and flicks to square leg
exploratory appeal from Yardy as he spears one in at Junaid's pads from over the wicket. Hit outside the line though, going over as well. But a touch of turn for Yardy!
tapped to point

slightly quicker from Collingwood, Junaid leans back and punches through cover out to the sweeper to bring up his fifty. Good innings from him, he had a tough time early on but he's stuck around. Bangladesh will want him to play a long innings today
driven to cover
hint of width on a length outside off, Raqibul looks to guide the ball to third man but finds the man at gully
Collingwood drifts into the pads and is tucked round the corner to fine leg, where Bresnan makes a good, sliding stop
jagging in after pitching, and Raqibul defends to off from the crease
fuller this time, and driven back to the bowler who collects in his follow-through
slammed back to the bowler, who gets a hand to it as he tumbles to his left. Can't quite stop it though, and Junaid calls Raqibul through for one
Raqibul leans across and pushes to straight midwicket
nudged to square leg this time, Junaid calls straight away for the single
speared in by Yardy, that was quick but leg-side in line and he's lucky to escape punishment as Junaid picks out square leg

gone this time! Darted in quick again, Junaid tries to clip through midwicket but is hit on the foot. Huge appeal from Yardy, and Asad Rauf agrees! Hitting him on the line of off stump, he was pressing forward but not that far down
slightly slower through the air, tapped back to the bowler
worked to leg, but can't beat the field
full, and driven out to the cover sweeper
Shakib shuffles slightly to off, playing across the front pad to work the ball to leg
nice and straight again from Collingwood, Shakib nudges to midwicket
driven just to the left of mid-off, and Shakib is off the mark with a quick single
pushed infront of square on the off side, point runs round to cut it off but they have time for an easy single
chopped down behind point
slightly too straight from Yardy, and Shakib nudges him to short fine leg
dinked through square leg for one
quick, and slightly short, but Shakib can't capitalise and the balls rolls to leg off the glove
Yardy's not flighting them! Hurled down full and fast, Shakib digs out a yorker
on a length on off stump to finish, Shakib defends
Collingwood continues to wobble the ball down on a tight line, and it's carefully blocked back to him
a touch overptched and it was really drilled back at the bowler, Collingwood got something on it but it still sped towards the long off boundary where only some sliding fielding prevented four
this is hit less firmly, but still a single through cover
Shakib opens the face and clips it down to third man for a single. England look a touch innocuous
nicely bowled, another slower ball from Collingwood, I'm not sure he's got a quicker one,  pushed quietly to cover
Collingwood drifts a fraction towards leg stump and it worked round the corner for a strike-stealing single
who starts by beating the bat, not with a peachy leg-cutter, but with a widish ball dragged down that Raqibul plays and misses at
better ball this time, driven back past the bowler without much timing for a single
back of a length to Shakib and it's blocked to cover
lovely shot, Anderson overpitched but Shakib really dismissed this, powering it through cover. He didn't move after he played the shot, knew he nailed it
good batting, everyone likes the boundary-single combination, dropped by his feet and he scuttles off for one
Raqibul has actually played very nicely, quietly working the ball around, just gliding this down to third man
full and straight and blocked. Simple stuff from Collingwood
once again Collingwood giving away no room to work with so it's blocked
touch of width, only a fraction, and neatly worked down to third man
poor shot from Shakib, rooted to the crease and aiming a loose cut which he misses
this keeps a touch low, or at least that's what Kieswetter would have you think, he's been very noisy behind the sticks
Shakib gets four, but it wasn't at all convincing. Shakib lost patience after the series of dots and flapped at it, getting it very high and down to cow corner for another boundary
four more, Anderson will think himself a little hard done by, good leg-cutter finds the outer-half of a guide shot, that goes fine down to the third man boundary for four
this time the glide is more firmly played, so it goes squarer and straight to third man
short and Shakib is back and pulling confidently, collecting a single for his effort
neatly played, soft hands dropped to square leg for one more
Shakib plays this very correctly, with the straightest of bats, pushing down the ground
more ill-fortune for Anderson and the poor fellow looks thoroughly unamused, it was short and Shakib aimed a pull which came off the top edge and looped gently short of cover
and Raqibul greets it with a crisp straight drive to bring up his fifty from 61 deliveries, very well played indeed
he gets a couple more, opening the face nicely to glide it to a fine third man
this time the check drive through straightish midwicket almost found a diving Anderson at short midwicket, but no alarms in the end
another single here, worked into space
nothing here for Raqibul, punching a drive firmly to cover
good finish to the over from Collingwood, holding a straight line on a decent length, it's pushed back to him
Yardy back into the attack and starts well, darting it in full, Shakib digs it out
Shakib works this round the corner for a quiet single
Yardy very wide of the crease, firing it in quickly, Raqibul pushes back to the bowler

more good bowling from Yardy, flat and quick and straight, Raqibul pushes to extra cover, sets off for one and is sent back, Collingwood fires a throw in but by the time Kieswetter breaks the stumps, Raqibul is home
touch fuller, and a touch a wider, allows a push through point for one
another single here, turned in front of midwicket for one
Collingwood has done a decent job, Shakib tries to squeeze a cut away but the delivery is too straight
Shakib has to play around his front pad a fraction here and squeezes an edge into his pad, causing all kinds of yelps from the England fielders
this keeps a fraction low and Shakib can't find a space in the off side to push it to
another one keeping a fraction low, once again Shakib can't pick a gap

dropped by Kieswetter, that is  disappointing, but it was a tough chance, Collingwood found a touch of extra bounce this time, got a top-edge from Shakib's cut and it was quite a big deflection to Kieswetter standing up to the stumps
maiden over, keeps a touch low and defended
close here, a reverse-sweep attempted but he doesn't connect
more convention here, driven to cover
this time it's turned into the midwicket region
single taken this time, tapped towards cover
more good stuff from Yardy, Shakib can only get a single, deflecting this towards square leg
outside off stump, pushed gently to deep cover and another single
this is middle-over milking at it's best, pushed very gently down the ground for a single
another single here, clipped firmly through a diving short midwicket, who palms it to long on
touch leg-sided from the bowler and worked to deep square
tighter line this time and Shakib can't force a single away
Shakib tries to manufacture something by sweeping, but misses and it crashes into his pads, big appeal from Collingwood, and though it would probably have clipped off stump it's too close a call
single this time, just worked to long on
good start from Broad, pinged down on a length at off stump, Shakib defends
the round-the-wicket angle is slightly misdirected and allows Shakib to clip it to square leg for a single
much fuller this time, Broad spearing in a yorker that Raqibul does well to dig out
back on a length, just a fraction down the leg side, Raqibul clips it away for one
good catch! Shakib smashed a wide ball firmly, but just too close to Anderson who held on to a low chance
neatly clipped for one to begin with for Mushfiqur, who standing next to Broad looks absolutely tiny
full to start, driven hard to mid-off
nudged onto the leg side this time, but they can't pick up a run as Wright runs round to cut it off in a flash
back of a length, outside off and Mushfiqur raises himself up to maximum height to get on top of it and guide to third man
run down off the face of the blade to third man again
nudged gently to mid-on
driven nicely out of the middle, but extra cover tumbles to his right to stop it cleanly and negate the single
dug in halfway down by Broad, and the ball balloons down the leg side to be called wide
was that the cross-seam delivery? It seemed to stick in the wicket and struck the splice to go to gully. Nope, that was seam-up, must've just hit the seam for some extra bounce
fuller and straighter this time, flicked to midwicket
Broad continues to bowl the "heavy ball", as another length delivery jars the splice of the bat
short again from Broad, Raqibul ducks underneath it.
driven cautiously to extra cover

well, finally Raqibul tries something different! It was a strange-looking shot though, just paddled a length delivery to long leg. He looked ungainly playing it, but got a good connection and it was just a one-bounce four
yep, they're starting to have a go now. Still need to hit it though, as Mushfiqur has a wild swing outside off and connects with fresh air
nudged behind gully for a single

saved by seam movement! Raqibul just stepped away, exposing his stumps, and swiped at a straight ball on a length. Would've clattered into the stumps if it hadn't cut past the leg stump after pitching...
glanced uppishly to leg, fine leg runs round and hurls in the return
pushed to mid-on, who is deep and so the single was always on
short, angling down the leg side. Raqibul has a hook but can't get bat on it. Bresnan isn't happy with the wide call, but it was down the leg side
drilled to that deep mid-on again
full and slipping towards leg stump, but he can't get bat on it and takes it on the pad
tip-and-run to mid-on
flicked through leg, just the one

a mighty hit from the Mighty Atom! Full and straight, he got underneath it and sent the ball sailing way, way over midwicket. Great shot, resounding crack off the bat and looked like six as soon as he hit it
slipping down the leg side, clipping the pad on the way through to Kieswetter... or not, as it's called wide
slower delivery, back of a length and that's just gripped and bounced a touch. Mushfiqur plays it well though, sending the ball to third man
another one! Just as big! Anderson goes full and fast again and Mushfiqur lined him up for another massive mow over midwicket. Delightful stuff!
leg-stump half volley, whipped down to long leg
great yorker from Bresnan, Mushfiqur digs it out and they set off for a manic single. Bresnan picks it up in his follow-through but can't hit the stumps. He would've been out too!
drilled to mid-on on the edge of the circle
thigh-high full toss, and Mushfiqur has missed out on this. Just needed to get a touch on it
edged! But it was a slower ball outside off, was never going to carry

Mushfiqur goes! Another big hit, this one was straighter though. It was just too full and too straight to get underneath it properly, and though he got a decent connection he couldn't send the ball further than Luke Wright, who had been pushed back to long-on
on a length on off stump, Mahmudullah taps to extra cover
still can't get it away, just looking to nudge behind square on the off side but the ball moved in a touch to take the inside edge and ricochet into the pad.
bouncer, outside off and Mahmudullah ducks underneath it. He should  really be trying to get bat on ball here...
short-ish again, but on leg stump this time. Mahmudullah paddle-pulls down to fine leg off the glove, where the fielder makes a good, sliding stop
swivel-pull behind square on the leg side again
slower ball bouncer from Broad, and that was really slow. Raqibul was initially deceived, but had time to re-set himself and nudge to midwicket
another slower ball bouncer, just about picked again and flat-batted to mid-off
another one! Mahmudullah had no idea about this, he lost sight of it and was actually trying to leave when the ball struck the toe of the bat and went to gully.
Jimmy errs in line, spearing another cutter down the leg side
yet another slower ball bouncer, but this one is picked early by Raqibul - who has his eye in by now - and slapped up and over cover for an important boundary

quick yorker! Raqibul is struck flush on the front foot and knocked off his feet. Slipping down leg though. Well, they take a leg bye but Raqibul is down now, he doesn't look right. Physio comes out now. He looks to be in some pain, and appears to be asking for a runner
another sharp, inswinging yorker from Anderson and this one has picked up a wicket! Mahmudullah it was this time, struck on the foot as the ball swung in towards leg stump
worked onto the leg side, and a quick single to get off the mark
Broad comes round the wicket and fires one in to the new batsman's pads. He can't get anything on it though
leg-stump half-volley, clipped out to deep midwicket

nonsensical running! Total confusion as Raqibul clips to the wide midwicket. Faisal went nowhere, he must've been watching Raqibul who, obviously, wasn't running. Meanwhile, Shakib had set off for what should've been an easy single. The ball is hurled in to Kieswetter with Shakib stranded in the middle of the wicket. Raqibul grounds his bat, but it doesn't matter - he's out!
chopped behind square to get off the mark
full and flicked to midwicket. More hesitation in the running...
sharp bouncer! In the interests of self preservation Mashrafe buckles his knees and gets his head out of the way. That was very well-directed, followed him as he tried to get out of the way
full toss on off stump, dinked into the covers for one
another offstump full toss, this one is drilled down the ground, beating the bowler, the mid-off fielder and the man at long-on who charged round and attempted a sliding stop
very short on middle and leg, Anderson is lucky to get away with this one
big hit... but caught by Bell on the deep midwicket boundary. Mashrafe hit that well, but just couldn't get the distance as the ball caught in the breeze
very full, dug out to midwicket and they set off immediately for a sharp single
quick yorker on off stump, dug out to the off side this time and another single the result
swiped to mid-off, who fumbles slightly to let them through for one
Bresnan comes round the wicket and sends down a very full ball on off stump, which is flapped off the toe of the bat just wide of mid-off
flicked to long-on, Faisal wanted two here but was sent back
slower ball, Razzaq heaves to leg but can't time it and they pick up a single as the ball trickles towards midwicket

should've been a run out! Faisal dug out a yorker straight to the bowler with Razzaq backing up very far. Bresnan was not two metres away from the wicket, with all three to aim at, but flicks it wide and they pick up an overthrow to long-on
full, straight, clatter! Razzaq swings and misses and the ball smashes into his stumps to close the innings.

inn2.comm: starts well enough, finding a hint of swing into Strauss from a full length, that is pushed quietly to mid on
tight line again, no great pace though, Strauss works it to midwicket
hint of swing once more, which will please the new captain, Strauss once again works towards midwicket
touch fuller here, Strauss is forward and driving crisply to mid off
very tidy start from Mashrafe, full and straight and Strauss can only block
one poor ball ruins the over, of all places to bowl that is the worst to Strauss, short, touch wide and he unfurls his favourite cut shot, and collects four to the point boundary
decent start, good pace and outside off stump, left alone by Kieswetter
action replay, fullish length, good pace, outside off, left alone
Kieswetter is away, pushing into the cover region and setting off for a single
just a fraction down the leg side and Strauss happily works it off his hip for a couple to deep square
that's a better line, on and around off stump and Strauss can only defend
but this time the line drifts on to the hip again and Strauss picks off two more to deep midwicket
Mashrafe must be a little nervous, returning to the side as captain, but he starts he second over well enough, full and outside off, Kieswetter leaves
this time Kieswetter plays a shot, and times it well, but picks out short extra cover
good ball here, just a fraction shorter and straighter, Kieswetter is forward defending
slower ball and Kieswetter tries to run it down to third man, doesn't get much of it and it trickles behind the stumps
Kieswetter looks confident, striding into the ball, but it's a good delivery and he can only push down the wicket
good over ends with Kieswetter pushing to mid off for a swift single
big grunt from Shafiul, as why not, this is a zippy delivery on middle stump that Kieswetter defends in a hurry
top shot, that's what he's there for, just a fraction, nothing more than a fraction of width, and Kieswetter flashed his arms through it, pinging a square drive for four
good response from Shafiul, slower ball, but Kieswetter waits and drives firmly to cover
beaten! Just offered to hold it's line off the pitch, Kieswetter aiming a slightly open-faced tickle, ghosted past the edge and there was a faint late appeal
this time Kieswetter is much more secure, blocking firmly towards cover and collecting one
Strauss walks across his stumps here, but it's speared down the leg side
Strauss on the walk again, down the wicket and across to the off side, Shafiul drops it a touch shorter and Strauss plays a firm drive but it's well fielded at short extra cover
close here, Kieswetter advanced and Mashrafe dropped it in short, the attempted leg-side hoik came off the thigh pad and headed for the stumps, narrowly missing
big appeal here as Kieswetter is trapped on the pads as he tried to defend, but it looks a fraction high. Good stuff from Mashrafe
bit of a gift from Mashrafe but Kieswetter takes full toll. Slower ball dished up half-volley length on leg stump, Kieswetter gratefully flicked it over mid on, one-bounce to the long on boundary
Mashrafe back on to a good length and line and Kieswetter blocks
Kieswetter looks just a touch impatient here, this is a length ball he tries to pull but misses
well, Kieswetter will be much happier after that over, shortish ball angling into the legs, there are only three men set on the leg side so Kieswetter merrily flaps this over midwicket and gets four
Shafiul delivers this with a squeak, and it's banged in short and by the looks of things wide, it's well over Strauss's head but no wide given
nope, that length is still no good to Strauss, shortish, outside off, he eagerly cuts through point for four
change of angle from Shafiul, coming round the wicket, but no change of length, it's another half-tracker that Strauss swings over midwicket for another boundary
better length this time, but the line is wrong and Strauss works it round the corner for a couple
how about that! You don't normally associate this type of shot with Strauss but he's been working hard, skips down the wicket and eases a drive down the ground, one-bounce for four
better line and better length, and Strauss drops it by his feet and collects one
Bangladesh look a touch flat after that punishing over, here Mashrafe aims it around leg stump, Strauss clips it for a single to deep square
good from Mashrafe, holding a line and a length and Kieswetter can only defend
good running in the end, Kieswetter blocked called no, Strauss was having none of it and powered down the other end, Kieswetter had no option but to run and it was safe in the end
Strauss fancies it today, bristling with intent, Bangladesh may need a change of pace here, worked again into the midwicket region for a couple

how about that for timing! Mashrafe dished up another of his ill-fated slower balls, Strauss, even without pace on the ball, nailed a leg-side clip through midwicket, beating the fielder sweeping on the boundary
fifty up for England, and it's been quite swift, Strauss watches a slower ball on to his defensive bat, and sets off for a strike-stealing single
lolled up outside off stump, it's gentle but accurate and Strauss drives to cover
this time Strauss skips down the wicket, like it's the most natural thing in the world for him, which it isn't, and worked it to mid on for one
good stuff from Razzak, Yardy-esque, firing it in with a low arm and Kieswetter misses his nurdle
arrowed too far down the leg side, not even Mushfiqur can collect cleanly
false shot from Strauss, playing for turn that wasn't there and gets a leading edge
Strauss is skipping down the wicket once more and drilling a drive to a sliding mid on fielder, Strauss sets off for one, leaving poor old Kieswetter scrambling to get up the other end
quiet finish to the over, defended into the off side
ooh, lovely shot this, Strauss eases a drive through cover for four, so simple
Strauss is down the wicket again, clipping into the leg side
another sharp single here, pushed to mid on
Kieswetter is another happy to see the back of Australia, and he pushes this into the covers for a single
Strauss collects one here, working into the leg side
quiet finish to a good over from Shakib, patted down the wicket
having played so nicely this is a touch ugly from Strauss, trying to heave a sweep away despite two men being placed for the shot. He misses
good line here and a good length, Strauss defends
beaten! Outside off stump, Strauss is back looking to cut but it zips over the top edge
clump! Strauss didn't get all of this but he advanced down the wicket, met it on the full and slugged it over mid on for four
single this time, picked off into space
Kieswetter aims to pull, but gets very little of it and it trickles back to the bowler
well, doesn't matter what his record his, Strauss will put away full tosses like this in his sleep, lumping it to square leg
Kieswetter pushes this neatly to deep extra cover for a single
oops, shoved down the leg side and he'll have to bowl that again
driven down the ground for a gentle single
Kieswetter keeps this ticking over by working this towards long on
eased down the ground for another single
Kieswetter finds extra cover with a crisp back-foot drive
classic Strauss shot that, back cut neatly towards the point boundary to give Strauss a quick-fire 50 from 37 balls
Kieswetter looking to fire a drive out through extra cover, but can't time it

oh dear! Strauss will be furious with this, pushed gently to cover by Kieswetter and after a touch of hesitation Strauss ran through for the single, direct hit from cover, and Strauss, who didn't dive is short by a fraction. Strauss called the run, he should at least have tried to dive in. Ends an excellent innings from the England captain
starts by working it to leg for a single
top fielding there by Tamim on the long-on boundary, Kieswetter punched a drive firmly and Tamim slid round the boundary and cut it off one handed
driven again but without much timing
more confusion! Yes, no, wait, no, yes, no. In the end nothing happened because the point fielder didn't know what end to throw at
blocked away quietly this time
Bell gets a couple here, skipping down the wicket but then having to reach for it outside off, runs off the face to third man
Bell advances again, he's looking quite skittish, and blocked
plenty of movement up the crease from Bell but it's still only blocked
that ends a rather frenetic over, Bell defending tetchily
ping! That should settle England down a bit, Kieswetter timed this extra-cover drive brilliantly, sending it rocketing into the stands over extra cover
quietly defended this time
ooh, Kieswetter scurrying down the wicket and giving himself room, slices his drive over point
ooh, close for Bell this time, he chipped a drive down towards long on, but luckily for him, didn't time it too well
Kieswetter looking to drive again, but there is a fraction of spin and he can't time it
nicely played this time, clipping it down the ground firmly
Bell watches this carefully and deflects it down to short fine leg for a swift single
gone! Kieswetter falls! Kieswetter looked to smash a sweep over deep square for a maximum, but didn't time it perfectly and the man on the boundary takes a good chance above his head
no fuss, nurdled into the square leg region to get his innings underway
Bell is forward and defending
once again Bell pops forward, works it to midwicket
pushed down the ground for a single
pushed to point, but no run
pushed infront of square this time, and they snatch a single
dinked back to the bowler off the back foot
swatted down to long-off, again Collingwood stays deep in the crease with his weight back
punched down to long-off, extra cover dives but can't cut it off
well, Razzak keeps landing them there and the batsman are quite happy to just push down to long-off. Easy runs
clipped out to midwicket, and that'll bring up Englnand's 100
Bell presses forward to defend towards extra cover
speared in to middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
defended back down the pitch
tickled round the corner as the bowler errs towards leg stump, but the short fine leg fielder sprints round to stop the single
cracked out to deep cover
well, actually there's something there! Faisal really tossed it up to start and got the ball to grip and turn appreciably, squirting off the outer half to gully
looped up again, full toss on middle this time, but driven to the midwicket fielder
that's not pretty - long-hop outside off but Bell thumps it straight to the fielder
swept to short fine leg - straight to him - but they set off for a single anyway. Fairly manic, that would've been out if the throw had hit the stumps! No need for panic just yet
width offered outside off, slapped to cover
another sweep, long leg cleans up
pushed on the up to mid-on
on a length, just outside off. Collingwood pushes back towards the bowler... who's slipped over in his follow-through. But he's up straight away, and looks fine.
a fraction wider, tapped out into the covers off the back foot
and wider still, but Bell bottom-edges a forcing shot off the back foot
straighter this time, zeroing in on off stump as Bell shuffles across and nudges through square leg
backfoot punch goes out to the man sweeping on the cover boundary
solid forward defensive as Shakib spears one in to off stump very roundarm
Collingwood skips down the track but Shakib spots him coming and fires the ball wider of off, tapped to cover
this will be a run, and a nurdley one at that
Bell leans across to flick to midwicket
really floaty from Shakib, and he's done Collingwood in the flight as the batsman tries to work through midwicket but inside edges into his pads
just a hint of turn to finish the overs, and Collingwood defends
beautiful shot from Bell, who just shimmies down the wicket to get to the pitch and then aims an on drive back past the bowler. All balance, poise and high left elbow
full and straight again, this time Bell stays deep in the crease and whips to midwicket
huge, emotive appeal from Mashrafe as the ball keeps low and strikes Bell on the pad. He was hit well outside off though
back of a length, straight, and nudged off the hip behind square on the leg side
back of a length again, and rising, but Collingwood gets up on his toes to defend comfortably to off
driven on the up, but straight to extra cover
Bell skips down the track but Shakib, who has great guile as a bowler, spots him early and pulls the length back
tapped watchfully into the covers
an interesting battle is unfolding here, with Bell looking to move around in the crease and upset Shakib's rhythm. This is speared in flatter, and clipped to midwicket
punched down to long-off
floated up on off stump, and driven hard out to deep cover

what a ball! That's beaten everyone! Shakib flights one on middle and leg, the ball drifted a touch and really gripped and spun to beat Bell's attempted glance to leg. He stepped out of the crease as he played the shot...  but it was too good for Mushfiqur too, and he couldn't collect behind the stumps
strong shot from Collingwood, who drives on the up out to cover... but even better fielding, as the fielder charges after the ball and dives to pull it in inches from the boundary. Great effort
on a length, Bell goes deep in the crease to defend
a fraction too straight this time, and Bell easily picks the gap at midwicket to pick up runs. Loads of space out there with the field spread
chopped down to gully
well, half a chance for a run-out there, but instead it's two runs. Bangladesh have been pretty good in the field, but Rubel Hossain - the sub fielder - just over-ran it as he came in
and a single to finish the over, as a slower ball is nudged out on the leg side
he does float it up first up, but Bell was waiting for it with a premeditated lap to fine leg
tossed up on leg stump, and just nudged into space for a quick single
dragged down very short by Faisal, Bell leaps back into position to pull and cracks the ball hard out to deep midwicket
pushed out into the covers
again Collingwood stays on the back foot, and punches down the ground for a single
another mixed bag from Faisal, as he dishes up a long-hop on leg stump and is lucky only to concede one run as the ball is pulled down to fine leg
a hint of turn, but it's pitched too short and is easily worked through midwicket
tossed up very full outside off, and driven out to deep cover by Collingwood
flicked through square leg
full and wide, flashed behind square on the off side but pulled in before the boundary
punched into the off side, extra cover scoots round and just about cuts it off
full on middle and leg, driven out to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, some turn and bounce as it's clipped to midwicket
driven to extra cover
driven down the ground, the bowler makes an athletic diving stop in his follow through
too short, hammered to midwicket off the back foot
good line on middle and off from round the wicket, pushed watchfully back to the bowler

turn and bounce! The batsman is totally beaten... but Mushfiqur has worn that one on the face! That looked really painful, the ball pitched, turned and bounced sharply to strike Mushfiqur somewhere around the cheek or eyebrow. He's down and the physio is out. His left eye is already beginning to swell
floater on middle and leg, Collingwood lunges forward to defend
down the track this time, and smacking the ball out to deep midwicket with plenty of bottom hand
wides down the leg side as Razzak spears one down from round the wicket. Siddique didn't even get near it
a hint of turn, but just a fraction too short and wide of off and easily nudged to cover
Collingwood tries to launch this one! He came down the track but was somewhat beaten in the flight, got his body behind the ball though
speared down the leg side again, Siddique gets right across to cut it off this time and looks mighty pleased with himself
full and flicked to midwicket
elegant lofted drive from Bell. He danced down the track and caressed the ball up and over cover. Just tried to time it, not a power shot
punched down to long off from deep in the crease
tossed up high on leg stump, but swept out to fine leg on the boundary
flighted again, on off stump this time and drilled out to long-off
low, dipping full toss paddle-swept to fine leg
decent delivery, just the right length but Collingwood taps to cover
pushed down to long-on, and England are just cruising here
Razzak finds some drift on off stump as Collingwood aims a flashing square drive into the off side but squirts an inside edge to leg
hoicked across the line out to deep midwicket. Premeditated stroke, but the ball wasn't quite there to be hit
angled down behind gully for a single as Razzak offers a fraction of width
short, on leg stump and Collingwood hops back to swivel-pull down to fine leg. The man had been brought up to short fine, and once he was beaten it was four all the way
pushed defensively to off
tapped back to the bowler to finish
pitching middle and leg, Bell shuffles across to off but can't get it away
neat little sweep down to short fine leg
tossed up on middle and off, and driven down the ground to long-off
a gift - full toss outside off, but Bell doesn't accept it, picking up just a single out to deep midwicket with a sweep
punched hard to cover
Bell is done by some bounce and turn as Faisal gets another one to grip... But it would help if he could land two in a row on the spot
clipped neatly through midwicket for a single
nothing here for Bell, just popping forward and defending
single here for bell, pushed into the off side quietly
Shakib gets another! Well done him. Collingwood aimed a fearful mow into the leg side, got a big top edge and Siddique, the stand in keeper, took the catch. Much to the amusement off his team-mates
Morgan clips his first ball neatly to midwicket. Bangladesh should really be attacking Morgan at this stage but there are no close fielders in place
Morgan is off and running, bunting it down to long on
almost all over for Morgan there, he aimed a big cut shot and got an under edge that bounced just past the off stump
Bell gets forward and feathers it to cover for a single
cracking delivery that, spinning, bouncing and whizzing past Morgan's dangling outside edge
this time Morgan gets a full bat on it, clipping for a single into the leg side
Bell ticks it over by pushing to deep cover
arrowed down the leg side, Siddique behind the stumps couldn't get round, the umpire decides there was a faint edge so runs given
more good work from Shakib, Bell pats back to the bowler
nothing here for Bell, studiously forward and defending
this is a rather good shot, chips down the wicket, gets inside the line of the ball and lifts it gently into the gap between long on and deep cover, timing it perfectly to collect four
with the boundary taken he can happily return to defending
once more it's quietly patted away
Bell steals the strike by working it into space
Bell gets into position to sweep very early, so much so he just waits for the ball to hit the bat, and it dinks round for a single
Morgan gets a short ball that he cuts firmly to deep point
Bell has fifty, working it quietly to midwicket, it's been a very efficient innings after a slightly nervy start
big shot from the bowler as Morgan pops forward and defends with bat and pad
Morgan gets more bat on this and full-faces it back to the bowler
worked round the corner, but straight to the short fine leg fielder
nicely played again by Bell, he's timing those languid extra-cover drives superbly
this time it's defended carefully
a touch shorter here and Bell threads it through the covers off the back foot
Morgan gets forward and works it round to deep midwicket for a single
carefully blocked off the front foot
once again Bell feathers a defence
eased down the ground by Morgan, simply done
Bell tickles this round the corner and takes a single
Morgan forward this time and defending
nicely bowled, full and straight and Morgan defends
very nicely done by Morgan, brings up the England 200 in style, swinging his arms through the ball and sending it miles over long on for six
back and across here to cut, but sadly for Morgan he misses. Siddique behind the stumps fumbles
touch short and Bell is back cutting firmly through the covers for a single
Morgan turns his wrists over the ball and deflects it through midwicket for one
Bell reaches for the coaching manual and unveils a perfect forward defence
this turned more than Bell expected but he adjusted well and drove carefully through cover point
back to a defence here
another forward block to finish the over and that will be drinks
nicely bowled, just held back a fraction and Morgan defends
touch fuller, Morgan squeezes it out to mid on
this time it's much shorter, Morgan had plenty of time to cut, but it bounced a fraction more than he expected and he couldn't time the shot
nicely bowled, bit of spin and bounce outside off stump ghosts past Morgan's edge
wow this is well timed, looked effortless but it sped to the boundary he he clipped a full ball through midwicket
having just picked up the boundary he can happily defend here
this keeps a touch low, Bell drove off the back foot through cover easily enough
with the man up at short third man this shot was always on, Morgan reverse-sweeps powerfully, with real flourish for four
and back on the forward block
oops, Morgan has just gifted his wicket away. He was looking for a leg-side whip through straightish midwicket, but got it too square and sent it straight down the throat of the man on the boundary
the batsmen crossed so Bell has strike, and misses an attempted leg-side nurdle
connects this time and finds a single round the corner
Bell has the strike and clips it to midwicket for one
Yardy is not facing Tait here, and can happily push forward and pop it into the covers
quietly blocked away
Yardy this time feathers it into the covers and is off the mark
Bell goes down on one knee, but refuses to propose anything more than a paddle sweep for one
Yardy blocks it to cover to finish the over
chipped up and over the infield out to deep cover
paddle-swept by Yardy down to fine leg
Bell sweeps rather more firmly this time to send the ball out to deep square leg, a little fumble on the boundaries edge doesn't cost too much
darts one in on leg stump and Yardy tickles it down to fine leg
a fraction too short, but Bell can't capitalise as he chops the ball to point
a little more aggression and intent in the shot from Bell this time, but again his scything cut is stopped by the man at point
cracked off the back foot, but straight to extra cover
pushed to mid-on this time, again no run
going on with the arm from round the wicket, the ball squirts off the inside edge into the leg side
great shot from Bell, who's played this shot a few times already this innings. Mahmudullah stays round the wicket and Bell just skips down the track to lift the ball over cover with great finesse
nudged very fine on the leg side - was there bat on that? No
whipped off middle stump, but straight to midwicket
tossed up by Faisal, who continues to find turn. But well wide of off. Although, even so Bell can only slice to gully
Bell's first slog of the night with just 20-odd needed, as he aims a heave out to deep midwicket. Didn't middle it though, and the ball plugs in the turf and comes to a stop inside the rope
nudged to midwicket
Yardy shuffles across to try and work the angle between midwicket and square leg, but this time picks out that square leg fielder
driven out to deep cover
Bell stays deep in the crease and punches off the back foot out to deep cover
slower cutter to start, and it keeps a touch low as Shafiul sends it down just back-of-a-length on middle and off. Bell didn't quite seem to pick it up either, but they get a single
pacy this time, and Yardy defends into the covers from the crease
another slower cutter, this time its nudged down to fine leg by Yardy
slapped! Bell is keen to get this over with, as he comes charging down the track and slams a short, wide ball to the cover point boundary
bouncer from Shafiul this time, looked to be a slower one and Bell hooked it from head height down to long leg for another four! England are close now
Bell comes down the track once again, but this time displays his deft touch in guiding the ball to gully. It was a late cut really, and well-played
tip-and-run from Yardy to get Bell back on strike, and Bangladesh have well and truly given up here
dropped just behind square on the leg side
pushed down the ground, Shakib tumbles across in his follow-through but can't cut it off
arm ball from Shakib! Almost had the beating of Bell, as it nipped in to take the inside edge, ricochet off the pad and just miss the leg stump
punched out to long-off
cut away  behind square, and they pick up a couple
that's it, all over and England cruise to a six-wicket win as Bell steps back and swipes through cover
